title: Diddy ‘set to change his name again’ and become Sean Love Combs
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

It looks like Diddy, aka Sean Combs, is set to change his name yet again – and become Sean Love Combs.

The rapper and business mogul has reportedly taken legal action to officially change his middle name from John to Love, according to TMZ.

Diddy was said to have filed a petition in the Los Angeles County Superior Court in order to make the name change, with legal documents stating that he is changing his name from Sean John Combs to Sean Love Combs – although he did not give a reason as to why.

Advertisement

This isn’t the first time that Diddy has been known to change his name.

The 49-year-old previously joked in 2017 in a Twitter video that he was going to become ‘Brother Love’.

‘I have some very serious serious news,’ he began to say.

‘I’ve been praying on this and I decided to… change my name again. I’m just not who I am before. I’m something different.

‘So my new name is Love, aka Brother Love.’

Diddy is no stranger to a name change (Picture: Getty Images)

He later added that he would only answer to ‘Love’ or ‘Brother Love’, and not to any of his previous monikers.

Two days later however, he admitted that he was ‘joking’ regarding the name change – but in February 2018, he backtracked, and said he was going to be known simply as ‘Love’.

‘I never went back to Diddy and I made an edit from Brother Love, since I’m already black, to just Love,’ he said on Jimmy Kimmel Live.

‘The Brother seemed redundant. And it’s working out great. Who doesn’t love Love?’

Diddy asides, he has also previously been known under the stage names Puff Daddy, P Diddy, Puffy – and of course his real name, Sean Combs.

That’s a whole lot of names.

A rep for Diddy confirmed to Metro.co.uk that the name change is indeed true.
